bibl.title: Petitioner v. Defendant. Type of document
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

body.div1:
IN THE UNITED STATES CIRCUIT COURT, IN AND FOR THE DISTRICT OF WASHINGTON, NORTHERN DIVISION.
In the Matter of the Application of George Hawkins, for a Writ of Habeas Corpus.
UNITED STATES OF AMERICA, STATE OF WASHINGTON, COUNTY OF KING.
SS:
I, James E. Fenton, being duly sworn say; - That I am the Attorney of record for the above named George Hawkins, and make this affidavit for and in behalf of the said George Hawkins; that the said George Hawkins is a citizen of the United States and is now confined and imprisoned in the United States Penitentiary at McNeil's Island, in the District of Washington; that the said George Hawkins is the petitioner named in the petition for a writ of habeas corpus in the above entitled proceeding, filed with the Clerk of the above entitled court this 5th day of November, A.D., 1902; that the said George Hawkins seeks and prays for an order of this court that a writ of habeas corpus may be granted, directed to the Warden of the United States Penitentiary at McNeil's Island, in the State of Washington, commanding him to have the body of the said George Hawkins before this Honorable Court at the time and place therein to be specified, to do and receive what shall then and there be considered by this Honorable Court concerning him, together with the time and cause of his detention and the said writ, and that the said George Hawkins may be restored to his liberty and discharged from custody; that affiant is the attorney of record for the said George Hawkins, and the said petitioner prepared the said petition for a writ of habeas corpus and has full knowledge of all the matter therein stated, and believes that the said George Hawkins is entitled to the redress sought to be obtained by the said petition, and has good cause of action thereunder; that by reason of the poverty of the said George Hawkins, he the said George Hawkins is unalbe to pay the costs of prosecuting said proceedings for a writ of habeas corpus which he is about to commence, or to give security for the same, and there is no person interested in the said proceeding who is able to pay the security and
